level.heading: LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR PHYSIOTHERAPY ANCILLARY PROCEDURESERTIFICATION (ยง 17-4803)

level.text: An applicant who has completed educational requirements may apply for licensure in the District of Columbia in the following manner:
If the applicant graduated prior to September 1987 the applicant shall have successfully passed parts 1 and 2 of the national exam; or
If the applicant graduated prior to January 1, 1996, but after September 1987, the applicant shall have successfully passed parts 1, 2, and 3 of the national examination; or,
The applicant shall successfully pass the District of Columbia Chiropractic Exam and/or the National Boards SPEC Exam at the discretion of the D.C. Board of Chiropractic.
An applicant applying for licensure under this section shall also comply with ยง 4805.1.

In addition to the requirements provided in ยง 4802 for licensure, a chiropractor seeking to satisfy the requirements to qualify for physiotherapy and/or acupuncture ancillary procedures certification, shall achieve a passing score on the national examination for these test areas equal to or greater than the score recommended by the National Board of Chiropractic Examiners (NBCE).

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 53 DCR 87 (January 6, 2006); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 55 DCR 7938 (July 25, 2008); as amended by Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 58 DCR 8770 (October 14, 2011).
